member.name: HTTP_DATA_CHUNK
member.summary: The HTTP_DATA_CHUNK structure represents an individual block of data either in memory, in a file, or in the HTTP Server API response-fragment cache.

member.name: HTTP_DATA_CHUNK.DataChunkType
member.summary: Type of data store. This member can be one of the values from the HTTP_DATA_CHUNK_TYPE enumeration.

member.name: HTTP_DATA_CHUNK.FromMemory.pBuffer
member.summary: Pointer to the starting memory address of the data block.

member.name: HTTP_DATA_CHUNK.FromMemory.BufferLength
member.summary: Length, in bytes, of the data block.

member.name: HTTP_DATA_CHUNK.FromFileHandle.ByteRange
member.summary: An structure that specifies all or part of the file. To specify the entire file, set the StartingOffset member to zero and the Length member to HTTP_BYTE_RANGE_TO_EOF.

member.name: HTTP_DATA_CHUNK.FromFileHandle.FileHandle
member.summary: Open handle to the file in question.

member.name: HTTP_DATA_CHUNK.FromFragmentCache.FragmentNameLength
member.summary: Length, in bytes, of the fragment name not including the terminating null character.

member.name: HTTP_DATA_CHUNK.FromFragmentCache.pFragmentName
member.summary: Pointer to a string that contains the fragment name assigned when the fragment was added to the response-fragment cache using the function.

member.name: HTTP_DATA_CHUNK.FromFragmentCacheEx.ByteRange
member.summary: An structure specifying the byte range in the cached fragment.

summary.para: Pointer to a string that contains the fragment name assigned when the fragment was added to the response-fragment cache using the function. The length of the string cannot exceed 65532 bytes.
summary.div: Note This string must be NULL terminated.

member.name: HTTP_DATA_CHUNK.Trailers.TrailerCount
member.summary: Count of the number of structures in the array pointed to by pTrailers.

member.name: HTTP_DATA_CHUNK.Trailers.pTrailers
member.summary: Pointer to an array of structures containing the trailers.
